Contractors
At times, we enlist contractors to perform specialized maintenance and construction tasks. However, before choosing a contractor, we conduct a comprehensive assessment of their safety record. Itafos Conda LLC has a stringent policy of informing all contractors about potential hazards associated with their work and processes. Additionally, contractors are briefed on emergency response procedures in the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance.

5. FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Over the past five (5) years, there have been no incidents of accidental release of RMP regulated substances at the Itafos Conda LLC facility that caused any fatalities, injuries, or significant property damage on the premises.

6. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

At Itafos Conda LLC, we have a comprehensive emergency response plan in place to handle any accidental releases of hazardous materials. Our plan covers all aspects of emergency response, including providing adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuating affected areas, notifying local emergency response agencies and the public, and ensuring post-incident decontamination of affected areas. 

To ensure the effectiveness of our emergency response plan, we regularly inspect and service our emergency response equipment. Additionally, we promptly update our emergency response plan to reflect any pertinent changes in our processes that may require modified emergency response procedures. 

Our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified with the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) District 5 in Pocatello, ID. We prioritize the safety of our employees, customers, and the surrounding community, and are committed to being fully prepared for any emergency situation.

Management of Change
At Itafos Conda LLC, established protocols are in place to handle modifications in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Any employee whose job responsibilities are affected by a change in process conditions is promptly notified and provided with the necessary training to effectively manage the modification. This ensures the smooth functioning of the process and optimal safety measures are maintained.

Pre-startup Reviews
At Itafos Conda LLC, we conduct pre-start up safety reviews for both new processes and modifications to established processes as a regular practice. These reviews ensure that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup before equipment is put into operation.

Compliance Audits
Itafos Conda LLC performs regular audits to ensure compliance with the RMP rule provisions. These audits are conducted every 3 years, and any necessary corrective actions are promptly and safely taken. The aim is to maintain a high level of safety and adherence to regulations.

Incident Investigation
At Itafos Conda LLC, we take immediate action to thoroughly investigate any incidents that may have caused or could potentially cause a dangerous release of a regulated substance. Our goal is to identify the root cause of the incident and take corrective measures to prevent any future occurrences.


Employee Participation

Process Safety Information
At Itafos Conda LLC, we maintain meticulous safety records that comprehensively detail the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment designs involved in all of our processes.

Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
At our facility, we prioritize the safety of our processes by conducting thorough PHAs. Our team of qualified experts, with engineering and process operations knowledge, use a combination of What If/Checklist methodology to identify and efficiently control any hazards. These studies are revalidated every five years to ensure ongoing safety. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are promptly addressed. 

Operating Procedures
To ensure the safety of all activities within our covered processes, Itafos Conda LLC has written operating procedures in place. These procedures cover various modes of operation, including initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, startup after an emergency shutdown, and normal shutdown and startup. The information is reviewed annually and easily accessible to operators involved in the processes. Additionally, the facility has a fully implemented Startup, Shutdown, and Malfunction (SSM) Plan in accordance with 40 CFR 63.6(e)(3), which is on file with the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality.

Training
At Itafos Conda LLC, we have a thorough training program to ensure our employees who operate processes are skilled in the procedures associated with those processes. We provide refresher training every three years, and more frequently if necessary. Our goal is to maintain competence and safety in all operations.

Executive Summary of the RMP Plan for
Itafos Conda LLC
3010 Conda Road
Soda Springs, Idaho 83276

1. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

At Itafos Conda LLC, we prioritize the safety of our employees, the public, and the environment. To ensure this safety, we have a thorough accidental release prevention program that includes all aspects of our facility's operation, such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training. Our policy is to take necessary measures to prevent any potential releases of regulated substances. We have implemented a comprehensive Process Safety Management (PSM) program to ensure the highest level of safety.

2. THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

At our facility, we specialize in producing agricultural chemicals such as phosphoric acid and phosphate fertilizer. It is important to note that we handle one regulated substance, which is anhydrous ammonia. This chemical is specifically utilized in the production of granular phosphate fertilizer.

3. THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO(S) AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO(S) 

Accurately documenting offsite consequences is crucial in effectively communicating potential hazards associated with stationary sources. Itafos Conda LLC has performed offsite consequence analyses in accordance with the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) RMP Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidelines. These analyses were conducted to establish a practical emergency response plan and to inform the community about potential hazards. The EPA has received comprehensive information on release scenarios, projected off-site impact, and the estimated population in the affected area.
